intro: Pasania pachycarpa, commonly known as the thick-fruited pasania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its dense, woody growth and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are fleshy, berry-like structures that mature to a dark purple or black color. Pasania pachycarpa is often found in rocky or wooded habitats and is adapted to dry conditions.
